sentences: Tal on taskud igasuguseid asju täis.
Tuleviku pärast pole meil asja muretseda.
context: The Estonian word 'asi' is highly versatile and has multiple meanings depending on context. It can mean 'thing' or 'object' (referring to physical items), 'matter' or 'affair' when discussing issues or topics, 'business' in professional contexts, 'case' in legal situations, or even refer to materials/substances. The word also appears in various compound words and expressions. Its grammatical forms include the genitive singular 'asja', partitive singular 'asja', and plural form 'asjad'. This is one of the most common and useful vocabulary words in Estonian due to its wide range of applications.
